name: RunDotTEST
description: Task for running Parasoft dotTEST to ensure code quality and compliance with OWASP, CWE, PCI-DSS and more.
author: Parasoft

inputs.name: workingDir
inputs.label: dotTEST working directory:
inputs.helpMarkDown: A working directory for dotTEST.

inputs.name: installDir
inputs.label: dotTEST installation directory:
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify location where dotTEST has been installed on your agent. If not specified, dotTEST will be searched on PATH.

inputs.name: solution
inputs.label: Solution files:
inputs.helpMarkDown: Enter paths to solution files, each in new line. This setting supports ANT-style wildcards.

inputs.name: project
inputs.label: Project files:
inputs.helpMarkDown: Enter path(s) to project file(s), each in new line. This setting supports ANT-style wildcards.

inputs.name: website
inputs.label: Website project folder:
inputs.helpMarkDown: This setting enables to open a folder with website project when there is no solution file available.

inputs.name: testConfig
inputs.label: Test configuration:
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify URL or path to the test configuration used for analysis

inputs.name: resource
inputs.label: Resources:
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify solution-relative paths to testable resources. A resource can be a project in a solution, a directory of files in a project, or a file. Specify each in new line. E.g.: Solution/Project/File.cs

inputs.name: include
inputs.label: Included testables:
inputs.helpMarkDown: File system paths to resources which can be a project in a solution, a directory of files in a project, or a file to include it in analysis. Specify each in new line. This setting supports ANT-style wildcards.

inputs.name: exclude
inputs.label: Excluded testables:
inputs.helpMarkDown: File system paths to resources which can be a project in a solution, a directory of files in a project, or a file to exclude it from analysis. Specify each in new line. This setting supports ANT-style wildcards.

inputs.name: reportDir
inputs.label: Reports directory:
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify where dotTEST should generate report files with analysis results.

inputs.name: reportFormat
inputs.label: Report formats:
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify where dotTEST should generate report files with analysis results.

inputs.name: publish
inputs.label: Publish to DTP
inputs.helpMarkDown: Set to true to publish your report to the DTP server. Access to the DTP server should be configured via dotTEST settings.

inputs.name: property
inputs.label: Settings:
inputs.helpMarkDown: This parameter allows to Specify single configuration setting in the "key=value" format instead of using .properties files. Specify each in new line.

inputs.name: settings
inputs.label: Settings files:
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide paths to .properties files with dotTEST settings. Specify each in new line.

inputs.name: nobuild
inputs.label: Disable build
inputs.helpMarkDown: Enabling this option will skip the build which dotTEST performs prior to analysis. Please make sure that your sources are built before running dotTEST with this option.

inputs.name: reference
inputs.label: Additional reference assemblies:
inputs.helpMarkDown: Providing additional assemblies can help dotTEST to resolve missing dependencies. Specify each in new line. This setting supports ANT-style wildcards.

inputs.name: testTagFilter
inputs.label: Tests filter:
inputs.helpMarkDown: Filters tests execution which are tagged with specific issue tracking types/IDs. E.g.: "Bug=PR-12345"

inputs.name: solutionConfig
inputs.label: Solution configuration:
inputs.helpMarkDown: Solution configuration, e.g. "Debug". Use when specifying solution file.

inputs.name: projectConfig
inputs.label: Project configuration:
inputs.helpMarkDown: Project configuration, e.g. "Debug". Use when specifying project file.

inputs.name: targetPlatform
inputs.label: Target platform:
inputs.helpMarkDown: Target platform of the solution configuration (e.g."Any CPU") or project configuration (e.g. "AnyCPU").

inputs.name: out
inputs.label: Console output file:
inputs.helpMarkDown: Location of a file to which command line output will be written.

inputs.name: fail
inputs.label: Exit with fail status
inputs.helpMarkDown: Fails the command with exit code 2 or 4 if any findings are reported.

inputs.name: showsettings
inputs.label: Show all settings
inputs.helpMarkDown: If set to true, all the settings will get listed in command line output.
